subject: Music
subcategory: The History of Rock and Roll
title: Nirvana and the Grunge Explosion
description: A quick, practical guide to Nirvana and the Grunge Explosion.

hook.text: In 1991, a band from Seattle made hair metal extinct with a single song.

buildup.text: Smells Like Teen Spirit hit MTV and suddenly flannel shirts replaced spandex.

discovery.text: Grunge fused punk aggression with heavy metal riffs and raw emotional vulnerability.

twist.text: Kurt Cobain hated fame â€” the man who killed the rock star wanted to be left alone.

climax.text: Cobain died at 27, and grunge's moment ended almost as fast as it began.

punchline.text: Nirvana proved you could hate the spotlight and still change the world.

quiz.question: What song launched grunge into the mainstream?
options: Smells Like Teen Spirit by Nirvana
Stairway to Heaven by Led Zeppelin
